Hi Curran, thanks for responding. I don't have it hand as yet, when I do 
I'll scan it and measure it properly and post the pics though the 
measurements I do have are 76 x 76 x 5 mm.

Rich



Curran Campbell wrote:

> Rich,
>
> I would agree with you pretty much on every point.
> Has that Higo / Akasaka feel to it and iron looks
> cleaner, such that I would say mid to later Akasaka.
>
> The central design is very similar to one of the 2
> Akasaka tsuba I own (though shape and iron quality are
> different). Basically a sense of 'swirling motion'
> with paulownia flowers. It is one of my better tsubas
> and I believe it to be probably 3rd generation or
> around that time, though Jim G. has seen it and can
> correct me.
>    Since the central design element is so close, I'll
> try and photograph & post it for
> comparison/discussion.
>
> How thick is it at center? Does it thin out a mm or
> 2mm by the mimi?
>
> Curran
>
>
